intro: Sebastiania macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaved sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its large, glossy, elliptical leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in length. Its small, clustered flowers are typically yellow or orange, and it produces distinctive, red, fleshy fruits. Sebastiania macrophylla is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and unique appearance.
